contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} '''Family patrimony''' is a type of [[Civil law (legal system)|civil law]] [[patrimony]] that is created by [[marriage]] or [[civil union]] (where recognized) which creates a bundle of entitlements and [[obligation]]s that must be shared by the spouses or partners upon [[divorce]], [[annulment]], [[dissolution of marriage]] or dissolution of [[civil union]], when there must be a [[division of property]]. It is similar to the [[common law]] concept of [[community property]]. {{DEFAULTSORT:Family Patrimony}} [[Category:Civil law (legal system)]] {{Law-stub}}
